medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Diarrhea developed 4 weeks before presentation, increasing in frequency to 10 to 12 liquid stools daily, each with an average volume of 250 ml; there was occasional nausea and vomiting. No abdominal pain, hematochezia, or melena was reported. Prior to that, episodes of nonproductive cough had developed approximately 2.5 years before this presentation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with thymoma 5 years earlier, underwent chemotherapy and thymectomy. Diagnosis of autoimmune enteropathy and pure red-cell aplasia associated with thymoma.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandfather had cancer, possibly of the prostate; other family history is noncontributory.
medical_history.social_history: Works in a retail setting; does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
